ygData.subject: RE: Hand to Hand
ygData.msgSnippet: I can t confirm the reduction in punching delay (I sure hope so cause I got a level 15 monk) but high level monks can deal great amounts of damage without any
ygData.messageBody:
I can't confirm the reduction in punching delay (I sure hope so cause I got
a level 15 monk) but high level monks can deal great amounts of damage
without any speedup. At that level I think both dual wield and double attack
are maxxed at 250. According to a calculation chart I saw a monk has a 60%
chance of double attacking, 50% chance of dual wielding, 28% chance of
triple attacking, and ~16-18% chance of quad attacking. These, of course,
are punches for 40 pts of damage if I understand correctly (1 pt per
level?). And throw a 70-80 pt flying kick in there...

*drool*

Good Journey,

Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)

8)start out with
8)the same delay. Go watch a 40+ monk tank something the damage
8)they deal is
8)amazing.
8)
8)Naeeldar

8)>> Well, another thing to consider is the delay on hands is

8)>35 delay. But it's been claimed that monk punches speed up as
8)>they gain levels. I've never seen any empirical evidence for
8)>it though.
